etymology.interpretation: Combines imparting knowledge with guiding someone’s course, emphasizing instruction paired with direction. Common in contexts where a superior or elder provides moral or practical guidance.
etymology.simplification: 「導」 was simplified to 「导」 by collapsing the complex road (辶/道) and hand (寸) components into a streamlined form, reducing strokes while retaining the guiding/leading sense.

parts.english: to teach; instruction; religion; to educate
to guide; to lead; to direct; to conduct

examples.chinese: 老师耐心教导我们(老師耐心教導我們)。
父母的教导让我受益终生(父母的教導讓我受益終生)。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ de jiàodǎo ràng wǒ shòuyì zhōngshēng.
examples.english: My parents’ guidance benefits me for life.

examples.chinese: 他以身作则来教导新人(他以身作則來教導新人)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐshēn zuòzé lái jiàodǎo xīnrén.
examples.english: He sets an example to instruct the newcomers.
